intro: Farsetia aegyptia subsp. aegyptia, commonly known as the Egyptian farsetia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens in dry climates.
